messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 225
messages.msgSnippet: ... So what *does* a person need to know to be knowledgeable?  Isn t that going to be different for everyone?  What do *you* need to know, right now, to become
messages.messageBody:
>
>Oh, I'd buy an *unschooling* curriculum package in a heart beat. I need
>the version that teaches me what I need to know to be a knowledgeable
>person so I can give this gift to my kids.

So what *does* a person need to know to be knowledgeable? Isn't that going
to be different for everyone? What do *you* need to know, right now, to
become more knowledgeable? What's the next step on *your* path? I think
that's actually more valuable than knowing what your kids need to
know. (If that's even possible, given the ways that the world will have
changed even by the time they grow up.)
Tia

No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
Eleanor Roosevelt
*********************************************
Tia Leschke
leschke@...
On Vancouver Island

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 225
messages.msgSnippet: From: Julie Stauffer ... I m finding this to be true. ... Oh, I d buy an *unschooling* curriculum package in a heart beat.  I need the version that teaches me
messages.messageBody:
From: Julie Stauffer
>I think it takes time for many of us to rediscover how fascinating the world
>is.<snip>

I'm finding this to be true.

>I think it is a gradual thing....as we move away from the frantic need
>to follow some type of schedule or curriculum,<snip>

Oh, I'd buy an *unschooling* curriculum package in a heart beat. I need the version that teaches me what I need to know to be a knowledgeable person so I can give this gift to my kids.

Now that I have a purpose to be knowledgeable, maybe I can pursue this. Too bad my memory is not what it used to be.

Pat


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 225
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Pat, I think it takes time for many of us to rediscover how fascinating the world is.  I think it is a gradual
messages.messageBody:
<<I want to be more interested and curious>>

Hi Pat,

I think it takes time for many of us to rediscover how fascinating the world
is. I think it is a gradual thing....as we move away from the frantic need
to follow some type of schedule or curriculum, as we begin to once more
actually breathe rather than pant, as we relax into ourselves, our children,
and our lives....it starts to happen.

Julie
